definition: to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer

sentences.english: Eg Even in most western countries, women do not always get equal pay for equal wok.
sentences.chinese: 即使在多数西方国家，妇女也不总是同工同酬的。

sentences.english: Women demand equal pay for equal work.
Article 2 The company protects the rights and interests of female employees according to the law.
sentences.chinese: 企业保障女职工获得平等的劳动权益，实行同工同酬。

sentences.english: Equal pay for equal work, paid leave, raising the minimum wage.
sentences.chinese: 平等同工同酬，带薪休假，提高最低工资标准。

sentences.english: Criminals sentenced to public surveillance shall, while engaged in labour, receive equal pay for equal work.
sentences.chinese: 对于被判处管制的犯罪分子，在劳动中应当同工同酬。

sentences.english: The government has time and again clarified its position on equal pay for women and men.
sentences.chinese: 政府已经反复阐明政府对男女同工同酬的立场。

sentences.english: Fourthly, to carry out the system of equal pay for equal work and enact special allowance policy.
sentences.chinese: 第四，实行同工同酬，出台特殊津贴政策。

pinyin: ba1 xiao3 shi2 gong1 zuo4 zhi4

definition: piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
labor contract/contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions
to be on the regular payroll/to be on the permanent staff
industrial relations/relations between labor and capital
time rate wage/remuneration based on one's time and skill/opposite: piece rate wage 計件工資|计件工资[ji4 jian4 gong1 zi1]
